d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:36): MegaVolt: du has keine Projekt-Datei?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:36): "ls *.pro" gibt nichts?
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:37): Nein, die MOC wird lediglich aus der include generiert..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:38): ja, aber es gibt so 'ne Fehlermeldung, wenn es keine Projekt Datei hat
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:38): Das Q_OBJECT macro ist den beiden h-Dateien aber enthalten..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:38): benutzst du qmake or autotools?
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:39): Wie sieht denn eine solche pro-Datei aus, oder wie kann man die erzeugen?!
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:39): qmake habe ich..  Aber bisher noch keine Erfahrung damit..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:39): siehst du was, wenn du "ls *.pro" machst?
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:39): Er findet nichts..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:39): ok, machst du etwas in KDevelop oder auf dem Konsole?
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:40): Ich habe KDevelop..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:40): im Konsole, weiss nicht was man sagt
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:40): macht nichts, wenn du es *jetzt* nicht benuetzst
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:40): so ist eigentlich gut
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:40): ok, du musst folgendes machen:
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:41): qmake -project; qmake; make
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:41): hoffentlich klappt's
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:41): Ich versuche es..
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:42): Oha, so richtig funktioniert das noch nicht, aber es kommen eine Menge Meldungen..

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:46): wenn es KDE 3 ist, denn braucht du leider nicht qmake sondern autotools.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:46): Es ist kein reine Qt Programmierung mehr.
e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:46): Er hat ziehmlich viele Fehler mit der Datei daemonthred.c und daemonthread.h angezeigt..

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:47): make >log.txt 2&>1

e86c5c46afb0326f8da82a8ba580cbe4 (10:57): Okay..  Thanks for your many help..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:57): and if you ask in #kde-devel, you probably *won't* get much help if you just dump error messages at them

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:59): I just mean, if you're having trouble getting started with KDevelop (or your own scripts) to make a KDE app, it's better to say that rather than expect them to diagnose the errors
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (10:59): as a starting point anyway
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:06): blockd: where are you from, if i may ask?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:07): I taught myself German, and I used to be a lot better at it :\
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:07): you speak good german
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:07): as far as i can grok it :)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:07): I haven't really spoken it much in four years so now I speak mangled German. But I can still read it OK.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:07): german is an interesting language
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:08): not *too* hard to learn
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:08): heh, now I'm noticing all these stray s's in what I wrote..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:09): no, but it does take some getting used to if your first language is English
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:09): not to mention all the different syntax rules
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:10): 12 different ways to say "the". Of course a lot are repeats, but 12 different cases nonetheless.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:10): heh
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:11): i studied german two years in high school
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:11): wasn't too motivated as it wasn't a subject i really needed to take
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:11): I mainly learned it because my French was so bad, and I felt like I should know a second language :-)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:11): but i still grok a fair deal of written material
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:11): ho ho
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:12): they never really offered German in highschool around here
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:13): around here it's the language of choice after english
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:13): then maybe comes french and perhaps russian
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:16): here French is the second official language... *official* but a lot of Ontarians can barely speak it
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:16): yeah, i know

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:17): almost like a mark of pride or something.. but I think it's more to do with how it's taught and I learned German my own way and was better in a year than I was at French
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:17): schools aren't too good at teaching languages
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:17): and we learn French from grade 4.. or earlier if you take French immersion
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:17): actually, they suck
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (11:19): yep, half the time it starts off with "Let's memorize a list of nouns and adjectives. We'll teach you how to string a sentence together later, if at all"
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:26): yup
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:26): grammar shouldn't really be taught at all for the first five years
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:26): just get the kids to talk
18ea04769bec1e3d4e3871f1e4e2beeb (11:31): my kid says 'bababababababba' and 'dadadaddadadadda' and 'mumumumumumu' and 'pbpbppbpbpbpbpbp'
18ea04769bec1e3d4e3871f1e4e2beeb (11:32): oh, and 'wwwwwwwwwwwwwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa'
